intro: Corispermum hyssopifolium var. membranaceum, commonly known as the membranous corispermum, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Chenopodiaceae family, characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows as a low, sprawling shrub with a deep root system adapted to water scarcity. Its leaves are often covered in a waxy cuticle, which helps reduce water loss in harsh environments. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique adaptations to extreme climates.
